channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The cycling lane is littered with debris, 9th July
item.description:
The cycling lane on the hill is covered with road debris, broken car parts, discarded rubbish and leaves/twigs/sticks that have fallen down. This makes the cycling lane unsafe - risk of damage to bicycles - high risk of puncturing. It needs a road sweeper to go up and down to remove all of the detritus.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verges overgrown along A38, causing pedestrians to have to walk in the road, sometimes on blind bends, which is extremely dangerous, 8th July
item.description:
A38 from Marlpit Lane, Prior's Norton, along to the Coombe Hill junction. Pathways are considerably overgrown and there have been some near misses with pedestrians having to walk on the A38, putting pedestrians in considerable danger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped carrier bags of rubbish have split, 8th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple locations on Sherborne Place, 8th July
item.description:
There are multiple locations on Sherborne Place where the kerb and pavement are broken or damaged due to large and numerous vehicles mounting kerbs. There are more locations on this street than I can attach at once and it is spread across a large amount of the street. Some of the damage is pot holes, some is broken or loose kerb edging, some is in the road, some is the slabs at the entrance to the car park etc etc but most is at the end of the road where Bence vehicles queue and most damage is to the pavement and kerb . It would be worth sending someone to check the whole street both road and pavement to catch all the damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Sherborne Place, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Ovwrgrown plants, 8th July
item.description:
Foot path from ossage farm onto pine halt Andoversford Natural vegetation is causes route to be very overgrown and hog weed in the way also. Causing obstruction to styles and bridges all the way along. Been 3 weeks now and naturally continues to grow. Just needs a wee trim back so you can safley use the styles and bridges from exit on footpath of Ossage farm onto pine halt footpath area. Doesn't need hacking back to bare bones but just so it's clearer to get over the styles and bridges.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pine Halt, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Leigh, Tewkesbury
